revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-28 15:32:32.000000000', 'files': ['karbor/tests/unit/protection/test_provider.py', 'karbor/services/protection/provider.py', 'karbor/services/protection/manager.py'], 'message': 'Raise ProviderNotFound from ProviderRegistry

ProviderRegistry used to return None when the provider was not found.
Change this behavior - ProviderRegistry raises ProviderNotFound, and

Change-Id: I249875412c7307161f9022190807f8907e8f5f1e

commit_message:
Raise ProviderNotFound from ProviderRegistry

ProviderRegistry used to return None when the provider was not found.
Change this behavior - ProviderRegistry raises ProviderNotFound, and
it is the caller responsibility to handle the exception.

Change-Id: I249875412c7307161f9022190807f8907e8f5f1e

Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}, {'_account_id': 17998, 'name': 'UFCG OneView CI', 'email': 'ufcg-oneview-ci@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'ufcg-oneview-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19003, 'name': 'Fujitsu iRMC CI', 'email': 'fj-lsoft-irmcci@dl.jp.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'Fujitsu_iRMC_CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19339, 'name': 'Dell EMC Ironic CI', 'email': 'openstack-ironic-ci@dell.com', 'username': 'openstack-ironic-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2016-11-18 14:25:50.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/port.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_ports.py', 'releasenotes/notes/rely-on-standalone-ports-supported-8153e1135787828b.yaml', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py'], 'message': "Rely on portgroup standalone_ports_supported

Some hardware doesn't support portgroup fallback to single interface
fashion. This imposes additional restrictions on ports, for example
such ports will not support booting by PXE.
This patch adds restrictions setting pxe_enabled=True on ports that
are members of portgroups with standalone_ports_supported=False. And
vice versa portgroup.standalone_ports_supported can't be set to False
until portgroup contains ports with pxe_enabled=True.

Setting 'vif_port_id' means that we are using this port in standalone
mode. This patch also ensures that 'vif_port_id' can't be updated on
ports which are members of portgroups with
standalone_ports_supported=False. And vice versa updating portgroup
standalone_ports_supported=False is not allowed if portgroup contains
ports with extra/vif_port_id set.

Partial-bug: #1526403

Change-Id: I9b4682918725bed2da0b7c89666e2c37d8826290
"}]
commit_message:
Rely on portgroup standalone_ports_supported

Some hardware doesn't support portgroup fallback to single interface
fashion. This imposes additional restrictions on ports, for example
such ports will not support booting by PXE.
This patch adds restrictions setting pxe_enabled=True on ports that
are members of portgroups with standalone_ports_supported=False. And
vice versa portgroup.standalone_ports_supported can't be set to False
until portgroup contains ports with pxe_enabled=True.

Setting 'vif_port_id' means that we are using this port in standalone
mode. This patch also ensures that 'vif_port_id' can't be updated on
ports which are members of portgroups with
standalone_ports_supported=False. And vice versa updating portgroup
standalone_ports_supported=False is not allowed if portgroup contains
ports with extra/vif_port_id set.

Partial-bug: #1526403

Change-Id: I9b4682918725bed2da0b7c89666e2c37d8826290

commit_message:
Handling KeyError error, make gnocchi event dispatcher work

Events data through database models format conversion, and our code is
not considered conversion,make _delete_event() can't get resource id,
image has not associated resource,so set image 'event_associated_resources'
is None.

Os-vif already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
 setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
 pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

Os-vif already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
 setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
 pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Ibd7bde8bef011e56132ee6c4db6c79a724601e23
Closes-Bug: #1608980

commit_message:
rest: don't ignore measures of created metrics

When we batch measurements with create_metrics=True, and
a metric is created, we miss to add their measures.

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: Ic2ef94cb620c1e819ab76d973442037b8de59672

If live_migration_inbound_addr is set in nova.conf, value of the option
will be saved under target_connect_addr in migrate_data. Unfortunately,
the type of value saved in target_connect_addr is unicode, therefore
when creating URI for live migration over dedicated interface we are
ending up with unicode type which is not acceptable by libvirt. To fix

Change-Id: I651cc7a45fe06a2b6d81e007c4faf62947ee3203

commit_message:
Convert live migration uri back to string

If live_migration_inbound_addr is set in nova.conf, value of the option
will be saved under target_connect_addr in migrate_data. Unfortunately,
the type of value saved in target_connect_addr is unicode, therefore
when creating URI for live migration over dedicated interface we are
ending up with unicode type which is not acceptable by libvirt. To fix
the issue let's convert URI explictly back to string.

Change-Id: I651cc7a45fe06a2b6d81e007c4faf62947ee3203
Closes-Bug: #1638625

subject: Wait for FIP status to get to DOWN in test_router_rescheduling

If we don't wait until the port actually gets to DOWN in database, we
may proceed to scheduling the router again and check floating IP status,
expecting it to be ACTIVE, but then catch DOWN still in database because
the router was slow to process the unscheduling event.

Closes-Bug: #1644937
Change-Id: I0806ead789953a4ff879ef9e6e77e1c66e658316
"}]
commit_message:
Wait for FIP status to get to DOWN in test_router_rescheduling

If we don't wait until the port actually gets to DOWN in database, we
may proceed to scheduling the router again and check floating IP status,
expecting it to be ACTIVE, but then catch DOWN still in database because
the router was slow to process the unscheduling event.

Closes-Bug: #1644937
Change-Id: I0806ead789953a4ff879ef9e6e77e1c66e658316

commit_message:
Remove unnecesorry ansible playbooks

We're currently planning to update ansible playbook as we refactor
our package directory, so many of the archived ansible playbooks
and unused playbook related to them are going to be outdated.

In this patch, I propose to removes these unused playbooks, to let
us find easily what we need to keep updated.

Change-Id: Ia48b87cbf3c61f2b7c635d717d5e9313100b8152

subject: trove-integration only runs for stable branches now
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 14:00:42.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "trove-integration only runs for stable branches now

Jobs for trove-integration are only to be run for stable
branches. This is because trove-integration (unbranched) is to be
eliminated soon. To that end, all the stuff in trove-integration was
moved into the branched trove repository early in the ocata cycle (now
called master). However, that change was not done for liberty, mitaka
and newton.

Therefore, when making a change to trove-integration, don't run any
jobs against the master branch of trove (hence the jobs being deleted
in this change).

Only run the jobs against the stable branches. Since liberty is going
bye-bye anyway, that job has been eliminated as well. We've made the
last release of liberty that we are going to be making and therefore,
no reason(s) exist to continue to test against that branch.

Change-Id: I2bcaf5cc6b67c103a88244e1c3ba955ef887547c
"}]
commit_message:
trove-integration only runs for stable branches now

Jobs for trove-integration are only to be run for stable
branches. This is because trove-integration (unbranched) is to be
eliminated soon. To that end, all the stuff in trove-integration was
moved into the branched trove repository early in the ocata cycle (now
called master). However, that change was not done for liberty, mitaka
and newton.

Therefore, when making a change to trove-integration, don't run any
jobs against the master branch of trove (hence the jobs being deleted
in this change).

Only run the jobs against the stable branches. Since liberty is going
bye-bye anyway, that job has been eliminated as well. We've made the
last release of liberty that we are going to be making and therefore,
no reason(s) exist to continue to test against that branch.

Change-Id: I2bcaf5cc6b67c103a88244e1c3ba955ef887547c

commit_message:
New CI service  -  Virtual PDU

The goal of having a VirtualPDU service in openstack is to help the ci
infra to test and validate changes to the pdu drivers and provide a way
to build integration tests for these drivers.

Change-Id: If5c468737e01eb450f8101e09e35963e9a13b207

subject: Allow splitting test groups into sub groups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 19:21:09.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/int_tests.py'], 'message': "Allow splitting test groups into sub groups

When registering a new test group we
give it a group name and a list of tests to run.

    register(['foo'], [t1, t2, t3])

creates group 'foo' running tests t1, t2 and t3.

This method has been extended to allow passing a dict
of tests with keys used as group name suffixes.

    register(['foo'], sub1=[t1, t2], sub2=[t3])

creates group 'foo' running all tests t1, t2 and t3
and groups 'foo_sub1' running t1, t2
and group 'foo_sub2' running t3

The plan is to split long-running datastore tests
into multiple sub-groups that can run as separate jobs.

Generally, we will want to run replication and
clustering in one job separate from everything else.
I have registered a 'single' (tests on a single instance)
and 'multi' (tests woring on a set of instances) sub-groups
for all datastores (for consistency).

This does not change how the tests run.
It just creates '*_single' and '*_multi' sub-groups in addition
to the existing '<datastore>_supported' groups.
We will need to update the project config to run sub-jobs
for datastores that require it.

Change-Id: Iea2a996043b4c2d1889995e160891af33ffab5b6
(cherry picked from commit 93f1ae8f09cf68cec62459822dfe39baf43a37a8)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow splitting test groups into sub groups

When registering a new test group we
give it a group name and a list of tests to run.

    register(['foo'], [t1, t2, t3])

creates group 'foo' running tests t1, t2 and t3.

This method has been extended to allow passing a dict
of tests with keys used as group name suffixes.

    register(['foo'], sub1=[t1, t2], sub2=[t3])

creates group 'foo' running all tests t1, t2 and t3
and groups 'foo_sub1' running t1, t2
and group 'foo_sub2' running t3

The plan is to split long-running datastore tests
into multiple sub-groups that can run as separate jobs.

Generally, we will want to run replication and
clustering in one job separate from everything else.
I have registered a 'single' (tests on a single instance)
and 'multi' (tests woring on a set of instances) sub-groups
for all datastores (for consistency).

This does not change how the tests run.
It just creates '*_single' and '*_multi' sub-groups in addition
to the existing '<datastore>_supported' groups.
We will need to update the project config to run sub-jobs
for datastores that require it.

Change-Id: Iea2a996043b4c2d1889995e160891af33ffab5b6
(cherry picked from commit 93f1ae8f09cf68cec62459822dfe39baf43a37a8)

commit_message:
Adds Manila-UI Devstack plugin

Manila-UI was being deployed if Manila plugin was enabled.
This is not the most advisable thing since counting on an UI
is not neccesary for the majority of the cases when contributing
code to Manila. This patch-set adds the posibility of deploying
the UI on demand by enabling it as a plugin for Devstack as follows:

enable_plugin manila-ui https://github.com/openstack/manila-ui

Change-Id: Id564e4ea6b675aa197ae377aa7a756e1bd0625b6
Closes-Bug: #1570033
Implements BP add-devstack-plugin

subject: Remove "group by" in queries when not necessary
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 09:06:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/files/grafana_dashboards/neutron_influxdb.json'], 'message': 'Remove "group by" in queries when not necessary

This removes the "group by" clause in InfluxDB queries when not
necessary. Without the "group by" clause, and by still using the "last"
aggregation function, only one result is returned by InfluxDB, resulting
in faster queries.

Change-Id: Icb5a809634e0b00680af1d2602fc2303928ee519
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "group by" in queries when not necessary

This removes the "group by" clause in InfluxDB queries when not
necessary. Without the "group by" clause, and by still using the "last"
aggregation function, only one result is returned by InfluxDB, resulting
in faster queries.

Change-Id: Icb5a809634e0b00680af1d2602fc2303928ee519

subject: (fix gate) Don't source openrc in gate run
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 13:27:24.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/redstack'], 'message': "(fix gate) Don't source openrc in gate run

This is a manual cherry pick of Iec71474ccfe757c8384c0b4e4b0758636668aebe

The latest set of changes to devstack include one where enabling a
plugin more than once now causes a fatal error. Trovestack code
sources openrc, which sources other files that eventually call
enable_plugin on the trove module. Unfortunately since trovestack also
sources some of the same files, this causes the error to be
triggered. The fix is to remove the call to openrc and just set the
credentials manually.

Change-Id: I887c980c75a093ce9c76bcd032b07069d61336ce
Co-Authored-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>
"}]
commit_message:
(fix gate) Don't source openrc in gate run

This is a manual cherry pick of Iec71474ccfe757c8384c0b4e4b0758636668aebe

The latest set of changes to devstack include one where enabling a
plugin more than once now causes a fatal error. Trovestack code
sources openrc, which sources other files that eventually call
enable_plugin on the trove module. Unfortunately since trovestack also
sources some of the same files, this causes the error to be
triggered. The fix is to remove the call to openrc and just set the
credentials manually.

Change-Id: I887c980c75a093ce9c76bcd032b07069d61336ce
Co-Authored-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>

subject: Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 04:13:00.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: Icbf6d9133d0a227654e1ad3bc69f0671cd09fb02
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: Icbf6d9133d0a227654e1ad3bc69f0671cd09fb02

commit_message:
Remove setup_client method

It is unnecessary to add setup_clients classmethod and create a new
variable for the client. I is more clear to use the original client name.
The client name 'client' is too much general compare to 'volumes_client'
and 'snapshots_client'.

Change-Id: I68a605ef2e1f893d54724c226512a0cbfa8f4bb2

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/a9926a344e9bc5cc3a3ba3a98b2483b4\n'

Change-Id: I4e71d4cbe0c505cf4b4bb0aeefdc161cb805b614

subject: Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-08 03:50:53.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_lib_charm_openstack_designate.py'], 'message': 'Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of
assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided
by testtools

Change-Id: If16d3c28a7c0d40b291f5f59d7413d401acd0502
'}]
commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of
assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided
by testtools

Change-Id: If16d3c28a7c0d40b291f5f59d7413d401acd0502

subject: Replace assertEquals with assertEqual
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 03:21:53.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_nova_compute_hooks.py', 'unit_tests/test_nova_compute_utils.py', 'unit_tests/test_nova_compute_contexts.py'], 'message': 'Replace assertEquals with assertEqual

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals
therefore we should use assertEqual instead.

Change-Id: I037d7f19ccfbb8a9dbf8c013f2cef30688dd7b06
Closes-Bug: #1218185
'}]
commit_message:
Replace assertEquals with assertEqual

The method assertEquals has been deprecated since python 2.7.
http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

Also in Python 3, a deprecated warning is raised when using assertEquals
therefore we should use assertEqual instead.

Change-Id: I037d7f19ccfbb8a9dbf8c013f2cef30688dd7b06
Closes-Bug: #1218185

commit_message:
[config-reference] Update the deprecation content

Running Cinder with a VMware vCenter version 5.1 is deprecated.
The minimum required version of vCenter server will be raised
to 5.5 in the 10.0.0 release.

Change-Id: Ibf9d239f9b4f5b593bb31c0a421a32f9ef120f20
Closes-Bug: #1593243

commit_message:
Remove useless singleton check

The code in __new__ is sufficient, no need to check that
__new__ did its job.

This change also adds a lock to ensure concurrency safety
to get the singleton object.

Change-Id: Ic43b2c3d24e9ccb077247d599fbd2325b683cbfb

        neutronclient/tests/functional/base.py

Change-Id: I17ab8accaa943b9ac04893b5e131be0afe0f5429
(cherry picked from commit a0f15a84d7f6bc1d21fa14c0a1cdbbc5ce683ae6)

commit_message:
Disable VPNaaS functional tests in the neutronclient gate

This addresses failures for neutronclient's functional job of
advanced services. VPNaaS is no longer maintained and thus it
makes sense to stop gating against it. Hook and tests are kept
for local development and in case things will resurrect back
to life.

This patch also makes extension functional tests conditional to
the presence of the extension under test.

Closes-bug: #1645819

Conflicts:
        neutronclient/tests/functional/base.py

Change-Id: I17ab8accaa943b9ac04893b5e131be0afe0f5429
(cherry picked from commit a0f15a84d7f6bc1d21fa14c0a1cdbbc5ce683ae6)

commit_message:
Update Amulet defs, series metadata and c-h sync

- Sync charm helpers if applicable.

- Fix test executable hashbags for virtualenv prep.

- Add Yakkety-Newton Amulet test definitions.

- Prep Xenial-Ocata Amulet test definitions (not yet enabled).

- Prep Zesty-Ocata Amulet test definitions (not yet enabled).

- Add Zesty charm series metadata.

- Remove Precise charm series metadata if present.

- Remove Precise Amulet test definitions if present.

Change-Id: I37ffb25e72998f4e128222c314423d204282aded

to specify binary package requirements for operations.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-24 16:07:48.000000000', 'files': ['roles/build-test-packages/tasks/dlrn.yml'], 'message': 'Only clone DLRN in role if needed

If we want to use the build-test-packages role to gate on DLRN
changes itself, we need it not to clone DLRN if it was already done

Change-Id: I830299a95286fcf174a3e78a29f163ab06e46cd0

commit_message:
Only clone DLRN in role if needed

If we want to use the build-test-packages role to gate on DLRN
changes itself, we need it not to clone DLRN if it was already done
by Zuul. Adding a check to skip it if needed.

Change-Id: I830299a95286fcf174a3e78a29f163ab06e46cd0

This patch applies password quality rules and satisfies the following
controls:

 - RHEL-07-010090
 - RHEL-07-010100
 - RHEL-07-010110
 - RHEL-07-010120
 - RHEL-07-010130
 - RHEL-07-010140
 - RHEL-07-010150
 - RHEL-07-010160

Each password quality requirement can be turned on/off with variables
and there is one master switch variable that turns them all off. The
master switch is off by default because these rules can cause problems
with existing systems if users aren't aware of the new requirements.

This will be explained in detail in the docs in the follow-on patch.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I3023715933321f11668c060046c065c17d7d2c6b
"}]
commit_message:
Apply password quality rules

This patch applies password quality rules and satisfies the following
controls:

 - RHEL-07-010090
 - RHEL-07-010100
 - RHEL-07-010110
 - RHEL-07-010120
 - RHEL-07-010130
 - RHEL-07-010140
 - RHEL-07-010150
 - RHEL-07-010160

Each password quality requirement can be turned on/off with variables
and there is one master switch variable that turns them all off. The
master switch is off by default because these rules can cause problems
with existing systems if users aren't aware of the new requirements.

This will be explained in detail in the docs in the follow-on patch.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I3023715933321f11668c060046c065c17d7d2c6b

subject: Update tox.ini for py27 requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-29 00:21:01.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update tox.ini for py27 requirement

Reactive source charms are Python3-only, but have py27 unit tests
declared in project-config.

The Tox tool recently changed behavior.  It used to pass when a tox
target was missing commands.  Now it fails in that case.

This commit places a py27 no-op shim to allow gate tests to pass,
effectively restoring the original behavior for these py3x-only repos.

Change-Id: Id421159a7fe5ab330a302172790994079e96319b
Partial-Bug: 1642981
'}]
commit_message:
Update tox.ini for py27 requirement

Reactive source charms are Python3-only, but have py27 unit tests
declared in project-config.

The Tox tool recently changed behavior.  It used to pass when a tox
target was missing commands.  Now it fails in that case.

This commit places a py27 no-op shim to allow gate tests to pass,
effectively restoring the original behavior for these py3x-only repos.

Change-Id: Id421159a7fe5ab330a302172790994079e96319b

commit_message:
Forbid contract migration scripts for Ocata

This test case will guarantee us that no unsafe contract scripts are
landed. Since in Ocata timeframe any contract script is unsafe, we
forbid them globally. Later in Pike, we may revisit the approach taken
here.

Change-Id: I5e72288ead653bdd4b5bc7e8e602a615826334fe
Partially-Implements: blueprint online-upgrades

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for py27 requirement

Reactive source charms are Python3-only, but have py27 unit tests
declared in project-config.

The Tox tool recently changed behavior.  It used to pass when a tox
target was missing commands.  Now it fails in that case.

This commit places a py27 no-op shim to allow gate tests to pass,
effectively restoring the original behavior for these py3x-only repos.

Change-Id: Ia3e7be0bf9ac085c66ce318f283f42b0c7cc73fe
Partial-Bug: 1642981

Update tox.ini for py27 requirement

Reactive source charms are Python3-only, but have py27 unit tests
declared in project-config.

The Tox tool recently changed behavior.  It used to pass when a tox
target was missing commands.  Now it fails in that case.

This commit places a py27 no-op shim to allow gate tests to pass,
effectively restoring the original behavior for these py3x-only repos.

commit_message:
remove extra error_log from gabbi test fixtures

The extra error_log part of gabbi test fixtures was specifically
bypassing our output capture and ending up blasting into the output
stream not under any control. This is exactly what we don't want to
happen and what we've been trying to remove other places.

Change-Id: Ied4d0481bdd9cf11f0b44b307a0aeddc1a5878ed

commit_message:
Various post-upgrade fixes

The config file gets restored so the config cache needs refreshing.

Touch .guestagent.prepare.end file after upgrade to fix the problem of
the guestagent not knowing if prepare has ran.

Write the volume mount to fstab to persist after subsequent restarts.

Change-Id: I3831de12c999ef8818e80ecdb29f1d86ff8cd5c8
Closes-bug: #1645460
Depends-On: I5c1714b7839b2736c50f2daa2f4506c4006815a1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-03 17:01:46.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/scripts/rhel-registration'], 'message': "Disable all repos during rhel registration

Some accounts get repos automatically enabled when the system is
registered, which is a problem because some of these repos pull in
things we don't want like early beta versions of software.  Since
a full list of desired repos is supposed to be included as part of
the registration config, let's just disable all repos to start with
to ensure we have a clean repo configuration.

I'm not sure whether satellite has the same problem (I would think
not, since satellite should only be providing the desired repos),
so I'm only making this change for portal registration.

Change-Id: I052080352e8b1c9b985e42d91a6c42b3258b0b11
Closes-Bug: 1629922
"}]
commit_message:
Disable all repos during rhel registration

Some accounts get repos automatically enabled when the system is
registered, which is a problem because some of these repos pull in
things we don't want like early beta versions of software.  Since
a full list of desired repos is supposed to be included as part of
the registration config, let's just disable all repos to start with
to ensure we have a clean repo configuration.

I'm not sure whether satellite has the same problem (I would think
not, since satellite should only be providing the desired repos),
so I'm only making this change for portal registration.

Change-Id: I052080352e8b1c9b985e42d91a6c42b3258b0b11
Closes-Bug: 1629922

subject: RabbitMQ cluster should work on api interface
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 10:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/rabbitmq/tasks/config.yml', 'ansible/library/rabbit_hostname.py', 'ansible/roles/rabbitmq/templates/rabbitmq-clusterer.config.j2', 'ansible/roles/rabbitmq/templates/rabbitmq-env.conf.j2'], 'message': 'RabbitMQ cluster should work on api interface

This patch ensures rabbitmq is configured to run on api
interface and  have short host names in /etc/hosts on each host.
Rabbit host names are generated and are not looked up in DNS

This ensures consistency accross whole RabbitMQ cluster.

Change-Id: Icaa31ccc04bf49291ceb8b5b74dd494bd0a0e159
'}]
commit_message:
RabbitMQ cluster should work on api interface

This patch ensures rabbitmq is configured to run on api
interface and  have short host names in /etc/hosts on each host.
Rabbit host names are generated and are not looked up in DNS
because of conflicting resolver results on different hosts.
This ensures consistency accross whole RabbitMQ cluster.

Change-Id: Icaa31ccc04bf49291ceb8b5b74dd494bd0a0e159

subject: Fix module apply
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-17 21:26:21.000000000', 'files': ['trove/module/models.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix_module_apply-042fc6e61f721540.yaml', 'trove/instance/service.py'], 'message': 'Fix module apply

The module feature of Trove has been designed to be idempotent, in
that a module should be able to be applied more than once with no ill
side effects. Unfortunately a new instance_modules record is written
for each apply, potentially leaving records behind on module-remove
that make it impossible to delete the module.

This has been fixed and code put in place on module-apply and
module-delete to remove any extraneous records.

Depends-On: Ia4fc545a10c7c16532aefd73818dd7d90c9c271b
Change-Id: I09b301c1fb8311f9c5bee07d0af398071da3dd24
Closes-Bug: #1640010
'}]
commit_message:
Fix module apply

The module feature of Trove has been designed to be idempotent, in
that a module should be able to be applied more than once with no ill
side effects. Unfortunately a new instance_modules record is written
for each apply, potentially leaving records behind on module-remove
that make it impossible to delete the module.

This has been fixed and code put in place on module-apply and
module-delete to remove any extraneous records.

Depends-On: Ia4fc545a10c7c16532aefd73818dd7d90c9c271b
Change-Id: I09b301c1fb8311f9c5bee07d0af398071da3dd24
Closes-Bug: #1640010

commit_message:
Disable VPNaaS functional tests in the neutronclient gate

This addresses failures for neutronclient's functional job of
advanced services. VPNaaS is no longer maintained and thus it
makes sense to stop gating against it. Hook and tests are kept
for local development and in case things will resurrect back
to life.

This patch also makes extension functional tests conditional to
the presence of the extension under test.

Closes-bug: #1645819

Change-Id: I17ab8accaa943b9ac04893b5e131be0afe0f5429

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-14 18:13:01.000000000', 'files': ['tools/trove-pylint.py'], 'message': 'when pylint has an error loading the config, it should fail

When someone has a pylint config file that has an error such as when a
merge goes bad, loading the file fails, and pylint motors along
happily with the default file (i.e. nothing ignored) and this is
confusing. Unless you happen to catch the little error that it prints

Instead, just bomb out with an error.

Closes-Bug: 1639040
'}]
commit_message:
when pylint has an error loading the config, it should fail

When someone has a pylint config file that has an error such as when a
merge goes bad, loading the file fails, and pylint motors along
happily with the default file (i.e. nothing ignored) and this is
confusing. Unless you happen to catch the little error that it prints
out.

Instead, just bomb out with an error.

Change-Id: Ie94dda35652f2a8f06502af72b68be73d61fc94a
Closes-Bug: 1639040

Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12444, 'name': 'John Schwarz', 'email': 'jschwarz@redhat.com', 'username': 'jschwarz'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-23 10:27:27.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/linuxbridge_agent'], 'message': "Fix devstack with linuxbridge without l3 agent

The linuxbridge agent for Neutron expects that the public bridge will
already be created by the time it starts. On devstack, this only occurs
as part of the l3 agent configuration. If a compute node doesn't have an
l3 agent and is using a linuxbridge agent, then br-ex won't be created
and the process will not be able to start (causing stack.sh to fail).

This causes the gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge-multinode-nv gate
to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1643562
Change-Id: I6f441c6febb5070ad885569d9c798634d0272b6c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix devstack with linuxbridge without l3 agent

The linuxbridge agent for Neutron expects that the public bridge will
already be created by the time it starts. On devstack, this only occurs
as part of the l3 agent configuration. If a compute node doesn't have an
l3 agent and is using a linuxbridge agent, then br-ex won't be created
and the process will not be able to start (causing stack.sh to fail).

This causes the gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge-multinode-nv gate
to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1643562
Change-Id: I6f441c6febb5070ad885569d9c798634d0272b6c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2419, 'name': 'Roland Hochmuth', 'email': 'roland.hochmuth@hpe.com', 'username': 'roland-hochmuth-s'}, {'_account_id': 16168, 'name': 'Tomasz Trębski', 'email': 'kornicameister@gmail.com', 'username': 'trebskit'}, {'_account_id': 16222, 'name': 'witek', 'email': 'witold.bedyk@suse.com', 'username': 'witek'}, {'_account_id': 18286, 'name': 'Shinya Kawabata', 'email': 's-kawabata@wx.jp.nec.com', 'username': 'kawabata'}, {'_account_id': 20033, 'name': 'Artur Basiak', 'email': 'artur.basiak@ts.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'abasiak'}, {'_account_id': 21922, 'name': 'Dobroslaw Zybort', 'email': 'dobroslaw.zybort@ts.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'dobrolaw.zybort'}, {'_account_id': 23043, 'name': 'Jakub Wachowski', 'email': 'jakub.wachowski@ts.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'wachowskij'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-30 06:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['monitoring/overview/views.py'], 'message': 'Proxy cookies from and to Kibana

The fts-keystone plugin uses sessions to store
information about authenticated user. As session id
is stored in a cookie, this needs to be passed
between browser and Kibana, so monasca-ui needs
to proxy them. Without this, every action (request)
in Kibana would need to be auhenticated by Keystone.
This results in unnecessary load on Keystone
and also impacts performance.

Change-Id: Ie682443e87ee43fa30beee637b7bbf3873362f25
'}]
commit_message:
Proxy cookies from and to Kibana

The fts-keystone plugin uses sessions to store
information about authenticated user. As session id
is stored in a cookie, this needs to be passed
between browser and Kibana, so monasca-ui needs
to proxy them. Without this, every action (request)
in Kibana would need to be auhenticated by Keystone.
This results in unnecessary load on Keystone
and also impacts performance.

Change-Id: Ie682443e87ee43fa30beee637b7bbf3873362f25

commit_message:
Remove translations for debug level log

According to the guideline of i18n, debug level info messages
should not be translated, they're for developers [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation

Change-Id: Id0562a6836878385912c8d6a95ed1bbc54f5ea77

commit_message:
Change node create notifications

As part of driver composition reform node creation with interfaces
validation will be moved to conductor service.
This patch change node create notification status from one "success"
to "start", "end" and "error".

Change-Id: I82e54bf7aafec671d3d1c081efa1094a4111a7a7

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/f8cdc5cce16393ddd9885f99ad05a610

Change-Id: I58f89eb319919a824fea21961b4338e2d1132f6e

It creates a mismatch between the generated Nova name
and its hostname which can lead to weird problems.

Closes-Bug: 1645730
Change-Id: I1c7dd459caefacaf41dd77e59c1a6e1df3ef0d42
'}]
commit_message:
Remove underscores from Nova server names

It creates a mismatch between the generated Nova name
and its hostname which can lead to weird problems.

Closes-Bug: 1645730
Change-Id: I1c7dd459caefacaf41dd77e59c1a6e1df3ef0d42

commit_message:
Add Created_at field to checkpoint list/show API

Checkpoint model had the 'Created_at' field, but it cannot
be shown in the CLI and UI, this patch is to add this field
to the API.

Change-Id: I332ae814848f0d5ee7ae9814df6f878ca461cff0
Closes-Bug: #1578563

commit_message:
Release python-mistralclient 2.1.2

A bug fix in 2.1.1 was incomplete. This release includes a backport[1] that
fixes a new occurance of this issue with TripleO CI. This change also
backports another bug fix that resolves issues with integration to
python-openstackclient.

[1]: Ia742a4e55b35c5a787e4606ff2f91425dd156e5e

Change-Id: I55458a1b91c44d296d3a20180070297bf491a5c6

query timeout.

This commit fixes that by matching by name when rest query

commit_message:
Added a new table for the router ports

The router ports are now referenced by the router object instead of
being part of the object itself.
This saves time in the serialization and deserialization of the object
when reading/writing from/to the DB.

Change-Id: Ibcc0a4c65047a45d4ce481927269c9aabf1c8896
Closes-Bug: #1559652

commit_message:
Handle stop rpc service at engine listener service

Since engine service has target queue.
To stop engine listener service, we should also stop rpc
service which only assigned to that engine listener service.
Partial-Bug: #1599104

Change-Id: I17a080bbbe67c0c1b1103a60c42c02804bb9abee

The default introspection time for shade may be too short for some
environments. As such, extending the timeout to be longer to provide
nodes an opportunity to boot, check-in, and reply with results.

The library default, which I believe is 900 seconds, was also based
on basic tests where I determined that _most_ systems should check-in
with-in based on:

 - 300 seconds to POST
 - 300 seconds to PXE
 - 300 seconds to Boot and start IPA.

Change-Id: If17c9d7c6acc19ec05a33fa57cb4bbbef1fa43d0
'}]
commit_message:
Test timeout extension for inspection

The default introspection time for shade may be too short for some
environments. As such, extending the timeout to be longer to provide
nodes an opportunity to boot, check-in, and reply with results.

The library default, which I believe is 900 seconds, was also based
on basic tests where I determined that _most_ systems should check-in
with-in based on:

 - 300 seconds to POST
 - 300 seconds to PXE
 - 300 seconds to Boot and start IPA.

Change-Id: If17c9d7c6acc19ec05a33fa57cb4bbbef1fa43d0

commit_message:
Allow separate control and vhost0 IPs in contrail-vrouter-agent.conf

Add possibility to separate the control path for XMPP communication
between vrouter and contrail controllers to go over a separate network
from tenant traffic.

Change-Id: If618adcf6a06c2da3089b62d7433adac2c431acd
Closes-bug: PROD-8436

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-10-19 19:31:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': 'Using get() method to prevent KeyError

Using get() to access keys like "summary.guest.toolsStatus" and
"summary.guest.toolrunningStatus" to avoid exception during hard reboot.
This change would use a default values even if they don't exist in dict
as we can have VMs where VM tools wouldn't be installed/running which leads
to hard reboot

Change-Id: I332867fe783d6d47b81d8a53153af140d4158217
Closes-bug: #1563325
'}]
commit_message:
Using get() method to prevent KeyError

Using get() to access keys like "summary.guest.toolsStatus" and
"summary.guest.toolrunningStatus" to avoid exception during hard reboot.
This change would use a default values even if they don't exist in dict
as we can have VMs where VM tools wouldn't be installed/running which leads
to hard reboot

Change-Id: I332867fe783d6d47b81d8a53153af140d4158217
Closes-bug: #1563325

commit_message:
Move gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge to devstack check/gate queues

integrated gate belly up. By moving this job to the check queue we
would no longer shoot ourselves in the foot.

but module 'synchronization' instead.

subject: Avoid some redundant db operations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 09:48:35.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': 'Avoid some redundant db operations

There are some redundant db operations in stack actions.
This change mainly includes:
1. only update the stack_user_project_id in _create_stack_user()
2. avoid to delete and set same tags if unneccesary

Change-Id: I6e972a2c988605d802475aee6810019b1a109a05
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid some redundant db operations

There are some redundant db operations in stack actions.
This change mainly includes:
1. only update the stack_user_project_id in _create_stack_user()
2. avoid to delete and set same tags if unneccesary

Change-Id: I6e972a2c988605d802475aee6810019b1a109a05

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-19 00:33:00.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Add project Octavia to OpenStack big-tent

This involves merging neutron-lbaas into the Octavia
project and migrating Octavia out of the neutron stadium, making
Octavia the Load Balancing As A Service (LBaaS) project for
OpenStack. Specs for exactly how this is going to happen are
linked as depends-on. The 'neutron-lbaas' repo will exist during
the transition, and eventually be retired with no impact on
operators/end users beyond packaging.

Change-Id: Ia807a5ad36859a0228aed76c307a97dec8494b7c
Depends-On: I5303b04ec2ca5acd525d9b5137f012515a8dc1df
Depends-On: I9bc348c6f86f868ec5e9ab2be2ae49947bfbacdc
"}]
commit_message:
Add project Octavia to OpenStack big-tent

This involves merging neutron-lbaas into the Octavia
project and migrating Octavia out of the neutron stadium, making
Octavia the Load Balancing As A Service (LBaaS) project for
OpenStack. Specs for exactly how this is going to happen are
linked as depends-on. The 'neutron-lbaas' repo will exist during
the transition, and eventually be retired with no impact on
operators/end users beyond packaging.

Change-Id: Ia807a5ad36859a0228aed76c307a97dec8494b7c
Depends-On: I5303b04ec2ca5acd525d9b5137f012515a8dc1df
Depends-On: I9bc348c6f86f868ec5e9ab2be2ae49947bfbacdc

Improve performance of stack filtering

all resources and another that filter resources.

subject: Replace deprecated oslo messaging config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-04 18:26:52.000000000', 'files': ['install.sh', 'doc/source/operating_guides/scale_deployment.rst', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_notifications.py'], 'message': "Replace deprecated oslo messaging config

Using 'rpc_backend' in 'DEFAULT' group, and 'rabbit_hosts', 'rabbit_password',
'rabbit_userid' from 'oslo_messaging_rabbit' group are deprecated from
oslo_messaging. We turn to use oslo.messaging.drivers and transport_url
config instead.

Depends-On: I32250da3832a80afc5c8ba2d01fd188a652c3af8

Change-Id: I3a5541dbb749372e69cda73407aa4becf6a95425
"}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated oslo messaging config

Using 'rpc_backend' in 'DEFAULT' group, and 'rabbit_hosts', 'rabbit_password',
'rabbit_userid' from 'oslo_messaging_rabbit' group are deprecated from
oslo_messaging. We turn to use oslo.messaging.drivers and transport_url
config instead.

Depends-On: I32250da3832a80afc5c8ba2d01fd188a652c3af8

Change-Id: I3a5541dbb749372e69cda73407aa4becf6a95425

In previous implementation we mistakenly iterate over filtered
resource list, so we miss some stack-like resources and do not

Also we should return empty list if there is no resources that

commit_message:
Handle nested stacks in resource search

In previous implementation we mistakenly iterate over filtered
resource list, so we miss some stack-like resources and do not
try to find resources in corresponding nested stack. We should
care about all nested stacks that satisfy max_depth condition.
Also we should return empty list if there is no resources that
matches request instead of NotFound.
Note that this change is acceptable according to api-wg
evaluating_api_changes: "Fixing a bug so that a request which
resulted in an error response before is now successful."  thoug
may seem backward-incompatible.

Change-Id: Ieb31f2d53a4a5f680e0af6864237ccccc1ada3e7
Closes-Bug: #1569296

subject: Improves SecurityGroup update handling for changes to rules.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-17 22:22:20.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/openstack/neutron/test_neutron_security_group.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/neutron/security_group.py'], 'message': 'Improves SecurityGroup update handling for changes to rules.

When running stack update to make changes to rules in
OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup, Heat will delete all the rules and then
recreate them based on the updated rule-set.  This can be disruptive to
instances that are members of the security group during the period between
removing rules and re-instating.

This change modifies the handle_update method to look at the delta in the
security group rule set and only affect changes.  Rules that are not in
the target rule-set will be removed and new rules will be added, but
unaffected rules will be left alone.
The change still caters for the default egress rules
  * adding them if no specific egress rule exists
  * deleting them if they exist and a new specific egress rule is added
    in the update.

Change-Id: I8874acbdcd342797ff55918f3eb1069fcb8c8798
Closes-Bug: #1582596
'}]
commit_message:
Improves SecurityGroup update handling for changes to rules.

When running stack update to make changes to rules in
OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup, Heat will delete all the rules and then
recreate them based on the updated rule-set.  This can be disruptive to
instances that are members of the security group during the period between
removing rules and re-instating.

This change modifies the handle_update method to look at the delta in the
security group rule set and only affect changes.  Rules that are not in
the target rule-set will be removed and new rules will be added, but
unaffected rules will be left alone.
The change still caters for the default egress rules
  * adding them if no specific egress rule exists
  * deleting them if they exist and a new specific egress rule is added
    in the update.

Change-Id: I8874acbdcd342797ff55918f3eb1069fcb8c8798
Closes-Bug: #1582596

commit_message:
Handle detach volume without attatched to any instance

Due to RPC timeout during attach call from cinder api
to cinder-volume, the volume may become in-use even
though nova fails the attach operation. The detach will
fail in this case, we need to detach the volumes by
calling cinder api to clean up such in-use volumes.

Change-Id: I3048a627c25a14109fa9b61554f55d9645d2a981
Closes-Bug: #1566300

instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

commit_message:
Convergence: Implement Stack Lifecycle Plugpoint

As is the case for the legacy engine, pre-ops and post-ops lifecycle plugpoints
will be executed now for all stack actions with convergence_engine switched on.

The only difference here is that care should be taken by the developers to make
the lifecycle plugin operations idempotent for convergence engines as the user
is now allowed to make concurrent updates to the stack.

Change-Id: Iadaa4b63841d1f4584afa3d2ab87a428129ace0f

subject: Improve glance image _show_resource
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-07 07:18:25.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/openstack/glance/test_image.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/glance/image.py'], 'message': "Improve glance image _show_resource

There are two problems in logic of image _show_resource:
1. the version condition-check makes no sense, because
the version is exactly '1.0' if using self.glance(), so we
won't enter 'else' block.
2. if user specify 'tags' when create image, there is no way to
show the attribute 'tags' info.

This changes the two problems aboved:
1. get common attributes from glancev1
2. get 'tags' info from glancev2 if user specify 'tags'

Change-Id: Ia62192a4352dd522709724abbbc655ce09568315
"}]
commit_message:
Improve glance image _show_resource

There are two problems in logic of image _show_resource:
1. the version condition-check makes no sense, because
the version is exactly '1.0' if using self.glance(), so we
won't enter 'else' block.
2. if user specify 'tags' when create image, there is no way to
show the attribute 'tags' info.

This changes the two problems aboved:
1. get common attributes from glancev1
2. get 'tags' info from glancev2 if user specify 'tags'

Change-Id: Ia62192a4352dd522709724abbbc655ce09568315

Due to overriding of 'get_reference_id'

an empty string value in properties which are
set with function like get_resource or get_attribute
during validation.
This patch corrects some validation checks to handle
such situations.
Also, minor fix in subnet's L348.

Change-Id: I54646fe1eeaa5c9ad23567f596ad330bc10e35da

commit_message:
Fix validate in neutron resources

Due to overriding of 'get_reference_id'
method in Neutron base resource, we can get
an empty string value in properties which are
set with function like get_resource or get_attribute
during validation.
This patch corrects some validation checks to handle
such situations.
Also, minor fix in subnet's L348.

Change-Id: I54646fe1eeaa5c9ad23567f596ad330bc10e35da

commit_message:
Add timeout for software/structured deployments

After the timeout is reached, the deployment will be marked as failed.
If the timeout is specified for a SoftwareDeploymentGroup, it will be
added to each deployment resource in the group.

Closes-Bug: #1557764

subject: Allow configuration of a maximum batch size for the task scheduler
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 7404, 'name': 'Ethan Lynn', 'email': 'xuanlangjian@gmail.com', 'username': 'GaryLynn'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}, {'_account_id': 12404, 'name': 'Rico Lin', 'email': 'ricolin@ricolky.com', 'username': 'rico.lin'}, {'_account_id': 13009, 'name': 'Peter Razumovsky', 'email': 'prazumovsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'prazumovsky'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-23 21:26:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/update.py', 'heat/tests/engine/test_scheduler.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/engine/scheduler.py', 'heat/common/config.py'], 'message': 'Allow configuration of a maximum batch size for the task scheduler

When running tasks in the scheduler, we used to simply start or step as many
tasks as we could before sleeping and then beginning again. When many
resources are in progress in parallel this can result in many API calls
executing in quick succession (i.e. without any intervening sleep), with
the result that we can hit quota limits. To prevent this, allow the
operator to configure a maximum number of resources that can be operated on
between sleeps.

Since creating resources is the most likely thing to cause problems, once
we hit the batch size limit on tasks to start, we prefer polling existing
tasks to starting new tasks. This will tend to limit the rate at which
resources get created in proportion to how long they take to create.

The current default is to maintain the existing behaviour; in future we
will likely want to tune this.

Change-Id: I50182d39a8e5bd479afb6662d080ca15e0b83fe5
'}]
commit_message:
Allow configuration of a maximum batch size for the task scheduler

When running tasks in the scheduler, we used to simply start or step as many
tasks as we could before sleeping and then beginning again. When many
resources are in progress in parallel this can result in many API calls
executing in quick succession (i.e. without any intervening sleep), with
the result that we can hit quota limits. To prevent this, allow the
operator to configure a maximum number of resources that can be operated on
between sleeps.

Since creating resources is the most likely thing to cause problems, once
we hit the batch size limit on tasks to start, we prefer polling existing
tasks to starting new tasks. This will tend to limit the rate at which
resources get created in proportion to how long they take to create.

The current default is to maintain the existing behaviour; in future we
will likely want to tune this.

Change-Id: I50182d39a8e5bd479afb6662d080ca15e0b83fe5

commit_message:
Migrate nova_instance to physical_resource_id in db schema

In resource table, nova_instance column is renamed to
physical_resource_id as it is appropriate.

This patch enables the migration of the column and after
3 release from newton, nova_instance column could be
completed removed from the schema.

while reading, it reads from nova_instance otherwise
from physical_resource_id. while writing both the columns
get updated. This logic will help to remove the old
column in p release.

Change-Id: Ibd0dedfc068734cf0653041b9b839b1de5cc004f
Partial-bug: #1346742

subject: Fix status reason in events for deployment signals
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 08:45:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_signal.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Fix status reason in events for deployment signals

When a signal is received and processed by a Resource, there could be an
event generated automatically. For such an event, Heat is supposed to
provide some useful message (including status_reason).  But currently,
the resource code can only process ceilometer alarms and watch rules,
for signals sent for a SoftwareDeployment resource, the signal is only
providing an string 'Unknown' as the status change reason.  This is
confusing when a user performs 'heat event-list stack'.

This patch adds an additional check whether the signal comes
from a SoftwareDeployment.  In that case, fill show the status
reason as 'deployment succeeded', or 'deployment failed (n)', where n is
the deploy_status_code that comes with the signal.

Change-Id: I79eed1af1a4b2a57fb6ef3586b1c892145dcbf65
Closes-Bug: #1564627
"}]
commit_message:
Fix status reason in events for deployment signals

When a signal is received and processed by a Resource, there could be an
event generated automatically. For such an event, Heat is supposed to
provide some useful message (including status_reason).  But currently,
the resource code can only process ceilometer alarms and watch rules,
for signals sent for a SoftwareDeployment resource, the signal is only
providing an string 'Unknown' as the status change reason.  This is
confusing when a user performs 'heat event-list stack'.

This patch adds an additional check whether the signal comes
from a SoftwareDeployment.  In that case, fill show the status
reason as 'deployment succeeded', or 'deployment failed (n)', where n is
the deploy_status_code that comes with the signal.

Change-Id: I79eed1af1a4b2a57fb6ef3586b1c892145dcbf65
Closes-Bug: #1564627

Currently, service engine periodically yields a status report into log
as 'info'. This is pretty annoying. We already have error report for
service death and info for service engine start. This patch proposes
making such a report as debug level.

Change-Id: I2938f205e7119a2ce42952438e7311c38cf09c9a

commit_message:
Silent service status report

Currently, service engine periodically yields a status report into log
as 'info'. This is pretty annoying. We already have error report for
service death and info for service engine start. This patch proposes
making such a report as debug level.

Change-Id: I2938f205e7119a2ce42952438e7311c38cf09c9a

"SubnetId", "NetworkInterfaceId" and "DeviceIndex" properties
for each network interface.
2. Refactor the _build_nics() method for aws instance resource,
allow user to specify subnets list to associate with the instance.
3. If user specify property "VPCZoneIdentifier" for aws autoscaling

commit_message:
Allow attach multiple nics for instance in asg

1. Define the keys for property "NetworkInterfaces",
and according to the docs of the aws, user can specify
"SubnetId", "NetworkInterfaceId" and "DeviceIndex" properties
for each network interface.
2. Refactor the _build_nics() method for aws instance resource,
allow user to specify subnets list to associate with the instance.
3. If user specify property "VPCZoneIdentifier" for aws autoscaling
group, to make the network interfaces for each members in group.

Change-Id: I8f34476bcae7f7c4b57262d66ef7920b78b8a8d2
Closes-Bug: #1476087

subject: Skip integration tests when test run is external
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-12 07:39:49.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/common/test.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_notifications.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_purge.py', 'heat_integrationtests/common/config.py', 'heat_integrationtests/heat_integrationtests.conf.sample', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_reload_on_sighup.py'], 'message': 'Skip integration tests when test run is external

Some particular integration tests can only succeed if the tests
are being run locally on the same node Heat is running,
but sometimes it might be useful to have ability to run these tests against
an already deployed remote Heat to validate its functionality.

This patch adds a new integration tests config option "external_test_run"
(defaults to False) and gives ability skip particular tests
if it is set to True.

Notification, reload on SIGHUP and purge deleted stacks tests
are marked as such outright.

Change-Id: I41ec69009e1e1c49d801e8855c8d3ed0505d8d94
'}]
commit_message:
Skip integration tests when test run is external

Some particular integration tests can only succeed if the tests
are being run locally on the same node Heat is running,
but sometimes it might be useful to have ability to run these tests against
an already deployed remote Heat to validate its functionality.

This patch adds a new integration tests config option "external_test_run"
(defaults to False) and gives ability skip particular tests
if it is set to True.

Notification, reload on SIGHUP and purge deleted stacks tests
are marked as such outright.

Change-Id: I41ec69009e1e1c49d801e8855c8d3ed0505d8d94

This change refactors the SwiftSignal and SwiftSignalHandle resources
to inherit all the signalling logic from WaitCondition and
WaitConditionHandle respectively. As part of this change, the format
of the signal metadata in all wait conditions has been changed from a
dictionary to a list, so that the order in which signals were fired

commit_message:
Inherit SwiftSignal behavior from WaitCondition

This change refactors the SwiftSignal and SwiftSignalHandle resources
to inherit all the signalling logic from WaitCondition and
WaitConditionHandle respectively. As part of this change, the format
of the signal metadata in all wait conditions has been changed from a
dictionary to a list, so that the order in which signals were fired
can be preserved.

Change-Id: I7d0a3f6a9b5baedd08216ffd7a1189af4293a98c
Implements: blueprint uniform-resource-signals

commit_message:
Cleanup old resources if they have been replaced

Cleanup old resources if they have been replaced, even if
the deletion_policy is 'Retain'.
This patch set the deletion_policy to 'Delete' for resources
when cleanup them if they have been replaced.

Closes-Bug: #1553088

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-01-14 10:07:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/objects/raw_template.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_update.py'], 'message': 'Catch all exceptions to move stack to UPDATE_FAILED

If an exception occurs after a stack has been put into
CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, but not while actually
running the tasks that perform the actual resource changes,
then the operation can be aborted leaving the stack stuck
in the IN_PROGRESS state.

This patch will catch any exceptions that happen after the
stack goes into the UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS, to make sure to
move the stack to FAILED with the reason.

Change-Id: I40214bd5dc5b16b3d9c4c0936516b0b3098b081c
Partial-Bug: #1492433
'}]
commit_message:
Catch all exceptions to move stack to UPDATE_FAILED

If an exception occurs after a stack has been put into
CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, but not while actually
running the tasks that perform the actual resource changes,
then the operation can be aborted leaving the stack stuck
in the IN_PROGRESS state.

This patch will catch any exceptions that happen after the
stack goes into the UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS, to make sure to
move the stack to FAILED with the reason.

Change-Id: I40214bd5dc5b16b3d9c4c0936516b0b3098b081c
Partial-Bug: #1492433

Currently only Stack Notifications are supported. However, to
enable more granular analysis of usage data from heat, we require
resource notifications as well.

Recently the following problem raised: in order to deploy
a node, OneView driver strongly requires to power off the
node just before calling set_boot_device.
Therefore the method for now is lazily applying boot device
and power off the node only when it is needed, so that it is
supposed to be consistent with other user's behaviour.

Closes-Bug: #1503855

commit_message:
Power off node in oneview

Recently the following problem raised: in order to deploy
a node, OneView driver strongly requires to power off the
node just before calling set_boot_device.
Therefore the method for now is lazily applying boot device
and power off the node only when it is needed, so that it is
supposed to be consistent with other user's behaviour.

Took into account removing 'vendor passthru' cleanup in
OneView deploy driver.

Change-Id: Iaa35e795e046acc676c2699949d768c8bd2bfa6c
Closes-Bug: #1503855

1. Create a new context which inherits all roles
of req.context to operate current actions(create/update)
if enable reauth.
2. Stored context is still used for deferred

Change-Id: I9fa4fd42223bcd671157c5c0c1ba54bb36261091
Closes-Bug: #1529354
'}]
commit_message:
Use reauth context instead of stored context if enable reauth

Two points after this patch:
1. Create a new context which inherits all roles
of req.context to operate current actions(create/update)
if enable reauth.
2. Stored context is still used for deferred
actions(such as resource signal).

Change-Id: I9fa4fd42223bcd671157c5c0c1ba54bb36261091
Closes-Bug: #1529354

subject: Store the raw, unparsed template in heat
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-28 19:41:58.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/template_format.py', 'heat/rpc/client.py', 'heat/objects/raw_template.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/071_raw_template_data.py', 'heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/api/openstack/v1/stacks.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': "Store the raw, unparsed template in heat

Currently, only a parsed version of the template is stored in the
database. As a result, any comments that the user may have supplied
are lost. Storing the unparsed version of the template will remedy
this by allowing us to show the original version of the template
used to create a stack in a call to 'get template'.

Change-Id: I2d6e317cd6fbfc83b1c83a73c1de905f699b763f
Implements: blueprint store-raw-template
"}]
commit_message:
Store the raw, unparsed template in heat

Currently, only a parsed version of the template is stored in the
database. As a result, any comments that the user may have supplied
are lost. Storing the unparsed version of the template will remedy
this by allowing us to show the original version of the template
used to create a stack in a call to 'get template'.

Change-Id: I2d6e317cd6fbfc83b1c83a73c1de905f699b763f
Implements: blueprint store-raw-template

subject: Support snapshot/restore for StackResources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-17 10:49:19.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/instance_group.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/autoscaling_group.py', 'heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py'], 'message': "Support snapshot/restore for StackResources

This change will support snapshot and restore for
'OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup' resource.
1. Add 'snapshot_id' property for the resource.
2. Call rpc api 'stack_snapshot' to snapshot for
nested_stack of the StackResource.
3. Update the StackResource's template with property
'snapshot_id'.
4. Call rpc api 'stack_restore' to restore the
nested_stack when updating.

Blueprint: snapshot-restore-stackresource

Change-Id: I0785fa7c79ba5e235baeababbe8e99e3a28e02ee
"}]
commit_message:
Support snapshot/restore for StackResources

This change will support snapshot and restore for
'OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup' resource.
1. Add 'snapshot_id' property for the resource.
2. Call rpc api 'stack_snapshot' to snapshot for
nested_stack of the StackResource.
3. Update the StackResource's template with property
'snapshot_id'.
4. Call rpc api 'stack_restore' to restore the
nested_stack when updating.

Blueprint: snapshot-restore-stackresource

Change-Id: I0785fa7c79ba5e235baeababbe8e99e3a28e02ee

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-04 12:28:26.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py'], 'message': 'Enable abandon option to nested resource

Resources use abandon_in_progress option for abandoning in
prepare_abandon method. When abandon_in_progress, resource's
deletion policy is "Retain" and resource will not delete. Nested
resource prepare_abandon missed enabling that option, so all nested
stacks delete.

Change-Id: I819566e4e1ca81193c745dcdd89217f31db41b07
Closes-bug: #1509912
(cherry picked from commit 103a09bc1c3e9f2e4894bba19963ca91b6652155)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable abandon option to nested resource

Resources use abandon_in_progress option for abandoning in
prepare_abandon method. When abandon_in_progress, resource's
deletion policy is "Retain" and resource will not delete. Nested
resource prepare_abandon missed enabling that option, so all nested
stacks delete.

Change-Id: I819566e4e1ca81193c745dcdd89217f31db41b07
Closes-bug: #1509912
(cherry picked from commit 103a09bc1c3e9f2e4894bba19963ca91b6652155)

commit_message:
Pass user/project domain id to ceilometer client

Init local request context with user/project domain infos

Set user/project domain id from req.headers while
init local request context. Then we can use them if needed.

Pass user/project domain id as `user_domain_id/project_domain_id`
to ceilometer client.

Change-Id: Ibbd363dc1d2e56fda98a5bd158a403c2f0941e85
Co-Authored-By: Rabi Mishra <ramishra@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1529058
(cherry picked from commit 5eec4c080f5a4dd7fc81eaeba9a734427c789255
and 378bcde62764e1271445354fedc57d982985ea0c)

commit_message:
Use assertGreater(len(x), 0) instead of assertTrue(len(x) > 0)

assertGreater provides a nicer error message if it fails.

Change-Id: Ia2ebe625d8a757f2ec1c38a321b5de3c676c57f0

subject: Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 02:56:55.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used
to keep codes from oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator.
Removing openstack/commonfrom all OpenStack code in favor of the
Oslo libraries is a project wide goal for the Ocata release. So
don't use this directory any more. We should drop it for improving
searching efficiency.

Change-Id: Idcce59c7cb84f205b589486fcdbc779f13053b9f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used
to keep codes from oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator.
Removing openstack/commonfrom all OpenStack code in favor of the
Oslo libraries is a project wide goal for the Ocata release. So
don't use this directory any more. We should drop it for improving
searching efficiency.

Change-Id: Idcce59c7cb84f205b589486fcdbc779f13053b9f

subject: devstack: tempest CI fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 04:05:05.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': 'devstack: tempest CI fails

With devstack update of changeset of
21d84c29b22fb69b00739ae40d69f80d5182a94e
change id of I9f1d7e58b861b04473b6a57c9ad404203fb7277a
causes tempest CI failure.
It checks if the plugin is already enabled, and if so, it exits with
error.
Since stackrc sources localrc, "source localrc; sourced stackrc" in
post_test_hook.sh causes enabling networking-odl twice.
Avoid source localrc in order to avoid failure.

Change-Id: Ibde74add0b42f4f05c5f6b77a8b66e31e85c4123
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: tempest CI fails

With devstack update of changeset of
21d84c29b22fb69b00739ae40d69f80d5182a94e
change id of I9f1d7e58b861b04473b6a57c9ad404203fb7277a
causes tempest CI failure.
It checks if the plugin is already enabled, and if so, it exits with
error.
Since stackrc sources localrc, "source localrc; sourced stackrc" in
post_test_hook.sh causes enabling networking-odl twice.
Avoid source localrc in order to avoid failure.

Change-Id: Ibde74add0b42f4f05c5f6b77a8b66e31e85c4123

This patch has to demonstrate performance improvements of
py27/py34/finctional job because of this oslo.policy patch:

commit_message:
Allow parameter duplication in parameter groups

We currently have a restriction that a valid paramater
can only be part of one parameter group. It would be
useful to remove that restriction for new hot template
versions.

Change-Id: Icb64b44c0d490ad02dbe74bcbe8f6d09c8a729fe

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-29 15:00:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': 'Never pass boolean deleted to instance_create()

This explicitly converts the deleted flag to an integer (which will
always be zero) at Instance.create() time. We already require it to
be False, but if set, we will pass the boolean instead of an integer,
which will confuse some (self-respecting) DBMs.

Change-Id: I67a340eea79b4423e77a00242ec6ae345e8c0e19
Closes-Bug: #1644513
'}]
commit_message:
Never pass boolean deleted to instance_create()

This explicitly converts the deleted flag to an integer (which will
always be zero) at Instance.create() time. We already require it to
be False, but if set, we will pass the boolean instead of an integer,
which will confuse some (self-respecting) DBMs.

Change-Id: I67a340eea79b4423e77a00242ec6ae345e8c0e19
Closes-Bug: #1644513

subject: (fix gate) Don't source openrc in gate run
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 03:52:43.000000000', 'files': ['integration/scripts/trovestack'], 'message': "(fix gate) Don't source openrc in gate run

The latest set of changes to devstack include one
where enabling a plugin more than once now causes
a fatal error.  Trovestack code sources openrc,
which sources other files that eventually call
enable_plugin on the trove module.  Unfortunately
since trovestack also sources some of the same
files, this causes the error to be triggered.

The fix is to remove the call to openrc and just
set the credentials manually.

Change-Id: Iec71474ccfe757c8384c0b4e4b0758636668aebe
"}]
commit_message:
(fix gate) Don't source openrc in gate run

The latest set of changes to devstack include one
where enabling a plugin more than once now causes
a fatal error.  Trovestack code sources openrc,
which sources other files that eventually call
enable_plugin on the trove module.  Unfortunately
since trovestack also sources some of the same
files, this causes the error to be triggered.

The fix is to remove the call to openrc and just
set the credentials manually.

Change-Id: Iec71474ccfe757c8384c0b4e4b0758636668aebe

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-06-13 11:09:23.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/db/api.py', 'tricircle/common/constants.py', 'tricircle/common/resource_handle.py', 'tricircle/nova_apigw/controllers/server_group.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/nova_apigw/controllers/test_server_group.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_plugin.py', 'tricircle/db/migrate_repo/versions/003_server_group.py', 'tricircle/nova_apigw/controllers/root.py', 'cmd/manage.py', 'tricircle/db/models.py'], 'message': "Support server group(part1)

Currently nova_apigw in the Tricircle doesn't support server
group[1], so we can't enforce affinity or anti-affinity policy
when creating VMs.

This patch adds server group support to the Tricircle. A server
group controller handling CRUD operations is implemented in
nova_apigw.

Server group controller will not create bottom server group when
handling server group creation. Bottom server group is created
during VM creation, like how we handle network, subnet, port
resources. Bottom server group creation will be implemented
in next patch.

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#os-server-groups-v2.1

Change-Id: I0a1330e421a1b3c4b9d4d57d03bac1ac5fdede22
"}]
commit_message:
Support server group(part1)

Currently nova_apigw in the Tricircle doesn't support server
group[1], so we can't enforce affinity or anti-affinity policy
when creating VMs.

This patch adds server group support to the Tricircle. A server
group controller handling CRUD operations is implemented in
nova_apigw.

Server group controller will not create bottom server group when
handling server group creation. Bottom server group is created
during VM creation, like how we handle network, subnet, port
resources. Bottom server group creation will be implemented
in next patch.

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#os-server-groups-v2.1

Change-Id: I0a1330e421a1b3c4b9d4d57d03bac1ac5fdede22

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11819, 'name': 'Chaoyi Huang', 'email': 'joehuang@huawei.com', 'username': 'joehuang'}, {'_account_id': 12076, 'name': 'Zhiyuan Cai', 'email': 'luckyvega.g@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhiyuan_cai'}, {'_account_id': 19060, 'name': 'Shinobu KINJO', 'email': 'shinobu@redhat.com', 'username': 'shinobu'}, {'_account_id': 19960, 'name': 'newypei', 'email': 'newypei@gmail.com', 'username': 'newypei'}, {'_account_id': 21023, 'name': 'Ronghui Cao', 'email': 'CR_hui@126.com', 'username': 'CR_hui'}, {'_account_id': 21033, 'name': 'XiongQiu Long', 'email': 'longxiongqiu123@163.com', 'username': 'XiongQiu'}, {'_account_id': 22559, 'name': 'Dongfeng Huang', 'email': 'yingfeicaozhang100527@gmail.com', 'username': 'southeast02'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-12 01:34:56.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/db/test_api.py', 'tricircle/db/migrate_repo/versions/001_init.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/db/test_models.py', 'tricircle/db/models.py'], 'message': 'Add resource_affinit_tag to the pod table

1. What is the problem?
In dynamic pod binding[1], the Tricircle needs to bind a tenant to a pod
which provisions a specific type of resources based on the  extra-spec.
Hence, each pod should be attached with a resource_affinity_tag, so that
the Tricircle can select all the pods whose resource_affinity_tag
matches the extra_spec tag.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
To facilitate selecting available pods which provision a type of
resources, we add a new column named “resource_affinity_tag” to the pod
table in this patch.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
No extra features needs to be implemented in this patch.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tricircle/blob/master/specs/dynamic-pod-binding.rst

Change-Id: Idc5628dbed3a86b53a3e1b7f77f14c5a90b95359
'}]
commit_message:
Add resource_affinit_tag to the pod table

1. What is the problem?
In dynamic pod binding[1], the Tricircle needs to bind a tenant to a pod
which provisions a specific type of resources based on the  extra-spec.
Hence, each pod should be attached with a resource_affinity_tag, so that
the Tricircle can select all the pods whose resource_affinity_tag
matches the extra_spec tag.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
To facilitate selecting available pods which provision a type of
resources, we add a new column named “resource_affinity_tag” to the pod
table in this patch.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
No extra features needs to be implemented in this patch.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tricircle/blob/master/specs/dynamic-pod-binding.rst

Change-Id: Idc5628dbed3a86b53a3e1b7f77f14c5a90b95359

commit_message:
[install] Remove chrony repositories on obs

The chrony package is included in the standard Leap 42.2 and SLES-12-SP2
repositories. It is not necessary anymore to add a special repository.

backport: newton
Change-Id: I94495209e12237eff5e5f26e56785173289e0494
(cherry picked from commit b6291c1ec80e5d61b36eda634a57777bfddee264)

Debootstrap only supports one apt repository to install packages from.
As a result, we do not consider the updates repo during debootstrap
causing us install a second kernel when we do an apt-get dist-upgrade
during build.

Change-Id: I6a592db6f0a01d3b19d8e0786e63f1315a1ef647
Closes-Bug: #1637516

commit_message:
Perform package install outside of debootstrap

Debootstrap only supports one apt repository to install packages from.
As a result, we do not consider the updates repo during debootstrap
causing us install a second kernel when we do an apt-get dist-upgrade
during build.

Lets use debootstrap to get us a minimal chroot, then add our repos and
install the correct packages from the start.

We also have to reorder the dpkg root.d scripts which configure apt so
they run before we perform our package installs.

Change-Id: I6a592db6f0a01d3b19d8e0786e63f1315a1ef647
Closes-Bug: #1637516

Kolla supports adding plugin to horizon and neutron-server images now,
but it doesn't support adding plugin to keystone image.

As keystone itself supports adding authentication plugins, there is a
good chance that user may implement their own plugins for keystone
authentication and identity. It would be better that kolla supports

commit_message:
Support adding customized plugin to keystone image

Kolla supports adding plugin to horizon and neutron-server images now,
but it doesn't support adding plugin to keystone image.

As keystone itself supports adding authentication plugins, there is a
good chance that user may implement their own plugins for keystone
authentication and identity. It would be better that kolla supports
adding plugin for keystone image just the way like horizon and neutron-server.

Change-Id: Id75c387668c6277efae05b59063f226843aa2a25
Closes-Bug: #1644133
